Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that George W. Bush did not completely repeal the estate tax. It was reduced and temporarily eliminated for a single year before reverting back to higher rates.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or sources to back up the assertion that Barack Obama wants to "restore" the estate tax.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that George W. Bush completely repealed the estate tax, which is not accurate.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim presents an alternative explanation to the assertion that George W. Bush repealed the estate tax by stating that it was reduced and temporarily eliminated for a single year before reverting back to higher rates.
